objects.name: APT1
objects.description: APT1 is a cyber espionage unit that is reportedly affiliated with the Chinese military. They have systematically stolen confidential data from at least 141 organizations across multiple industries.

objects.name: Internal Reconnaissance
objects.description: APT groups utilize custom scripts in order to automate the process of reconnaissance and identification of data of interest.

objects.name: Lateral Movement
objects.description: APT groups leverage compromised user credentials or pass-the-hash tools to gain access to additional computers and devices inside of a victim network.

objects.name: Maintain Presence
objects.description: APT groups often install new backdoors in the environment during the course of the campaign. They may install different families of malware on multiple computers and use a variety of command and control addresses.

objects.name: Complete Mission
objects.description: The main goal of APT intrusions is to steal data, including intellectual property, business contracts or negotiations, policy papers or internal memoranda.

objects.name: PsExec
objects.description: APT groups commonly use compromised credentials with PsExec to execute commands and install malware on remote systems.

objects.name: APT1 Malware
objects.description: APT1 uses a variety of malware families to maintain presence, including backdoors and other forms of malicious software.
